name: df-bpoly
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(cbp, cmpo(s0, s1, cn0, cc, cfv(cwrecs(clt, cn0, cmpt(s2, universe, csb(s3, cfv(chash, cdm(cv(s2))), co(co(cv(s1), cexp, cv(s3)), cmin, csu(s4, cdm(cv(s2)), co(co(cv(s3), cbc, cv(s4)), cmul, co(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s4)), cdiv, co(co(cv(s3), cmin, cv(s4)), caddc, nat1)))))))), cv(s0))))
comment: Define the Bernoulli polynomials. Here we use well-founded recursion to define the Bernoulli polynomials. This agrees with most textbook definitions, although explicit formulas do exist. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 22-May-2014.)
